es.text: No tenía ni idea de que estabas enferma.

en.text: I had no idea you were ill.

es.text: Me enteré de ello a través de Juana.

en.text: I learned about it through jane.

es.text: Menos mal que tropecé con ella.

en.text: It's a good thing I ran into her.
What have the doctors told you?
How did that happen to you?
When will you leave the hospital?

es.text: Si pudiera pagarlo, te llevaría a la Clínica Pérez.

en.text: If I could pay for it. I'd take you to the Perez Clinic.

es.text: Mantenme al día de cómo vas.

en.text: Keep me up to date on how you're doing.
Why do you want to talk about verbs?
Aren't you sick of practising verbs?
It depends on what verbs we practice.
Haven't we covered all the verbs?

es.text: Me lío con ese tiempo del verbo.

en.text: I get mixed up with that verb tense.

es.text: ¿Y tú no después de lo que he hecho yo?

en.text: And wouldn't you after what I've done?

es.text: Acabo de terminar de escribir más de 4.000 frases.

en.text: I've just finished writing more than 4,000 sentences.

es.text: Quiero decir que todo hasta ahora ha sido fácil para mí.

en.text: I mean that everything up to now has been easy for me.

es.text: Fallé muy pocos en el libro 3.

en.text: I missed very few in book 3.
Are you looking for a challenge?
I want something to push me.

es.text: Quiero que me pongas a prueba.

en.text: I want you to test me.
I want you to make me sweat.

es.text: Quiero el inglés como tu lo hablas.

en.text: I want English like you speak it.

es.text: Pero los tres primeros libros contienen el inglés de uso corriente.

en.text: But the first three books contain normal English.

es.text: Entonces ¿por qué me cuesta tanto entenderte cuando hablas?

en.text: Then why do I have so much trouble understanding you when you speak?

es.text: A lo mejor deberías limpiarte los oídos.

en.text: Maybe you should clean out your ears.

es.text: ¿Ves? Acabas de usar un verbo compuesto.

en.text: You see? You've just used a phrasal verb.
There are thousands of those verbs.

es.text: Pero son imposibles de asimilar si no vives en el país.

en.text: But they're impossible to assimilate if you don't live in the country.

es.text: Vale, tú te lo estás buscando.
Si yo supiera su nombre, le llamaría.

en.text: If I knew his mane, I'd call him.
Look it up in the telephone book.

es.text: Podría hacerlo si tuviera una guía telefónica.

en.text: I could do it if I had a telephone book.
Where there's a will there's a way.
Do you want me to leave?

es.text: Quiero que te calles, eso es todo.

en.text: I want you to shut up, that's all.

es.text: ¿Qué harías si yo desapareciera de la faz de la tierra?

en.text: What would you do if I disappeared from the face of the earth?
Since when are you a joker?

es.text: Esa es una faceta de tu carácter que nunca he visto.

en.text: That's a facet of your character I've never seen.
Do you think I'm a serious person?

es.text: Habla con mi mujer, ella te lo dirá.

en.text: Talk to my wife, she'll tell you.

es.text: Ah sí, y ¿qué harías si yo te apuntara con una pistola?

en.text: That's right, now what would you do if I pointed a gun at you?
Would you be afraid of me?

es.text: No serías capaz de semejante cosa.

en.text: You wouldn't be capable of such a thing.
Let's not talk about things like that.

es.text: Esta conversación es un callejón sin salida.

en.text: This conversation is a dead-end street.

es.text: No estamos llegando a ninguna parte.
Puedo traducir con facilidad esas cosas.

en.text: I can translate those things with ease.

es.text: Tu corbata no hace juego con tu traje.

en.text: Your tie doesn't match your suit.
Then why are you wearing it?
Because I like to stand out.

es.text: La gente se burla de ti.
Me gano la vida vendiendo coches usados.

en.text: I make a living selling used cars.

es.text: A ese precio, es una auténtica ganga.

en.text: At that price, it's a real bargain.

es.text: Esto nos perjudica nuestra capacidad para competir.

en.text: This hampers our ability to compete.
I had a flat tire, (a puncture)
I didn't have a spare tire.

es.text: Tardé una hora en resolver el problema.

en.text: It took me an hour to solve the problem.
A truck driver stopped to help me.

es.text: Si no hubiera parado, aún estaría allí.

en.text: If he hadn't stopped, I'd still be there.
It's a good thing he stopped.

es.text: Menos mal que hay gente como él.

en.text: It's a good thing there are people like him.
Let's go on to the following list.
What would you like to have?
I want a steak and potatoes.
How do you want your steak?
Would you like French fries or a baked potato?

es.text: ¿Me puede traer la cuenta, por favor?

en.text: Can you bring me the bill please?

es.text: Nos ha cobrado algo que no pedimos.

en.text: You charged us for something we didn't order.

es.text: ¿Lo pagará en metálico o con tarjeta?

en.text: Will you pay in cash or by card?

es.text: El accidente la dejó más débil.
Pero fortaleció sus ganas de vivir.

en.text: But it strengthened her will to live.

es.text: Sabía que nunca volvería a tener miedo.

en.text: She knew she'd never be afraid again.

es.text: Tendrás que dar marcha atrás para salir.

en.text: You'll have to back up to leave.
Put it in second gear to start.

es.text: Tienes que quitar el freno de mano.

en.text: You have to release the hand brake.

es.text: Tienes que usar el embrague para cambiar de marcha.

en.text: You have to use the clutch to change gears.

es.text: Manten las dos manos en el volante.

en.text: Keep both hands on the steering wheel.

es.text: No te acerques demasiado a ese coche.

en.text: Don't get too close to that car.

es.text: Mira atrás antes de cambiar de carril.
Tengo que mantener a mi familia.

en.text: I have to support my family.

es.text: Me cuesta llegar a fin de mes.

en.text: I have trouble getting to the end of the month.

es.text: Me castigan por cada error que cometo.

en.text: They punish me for every mistake I make.

es.text: Más vale pájaro en mano que ciento volando.

en.text: A bird in hand's better than two in the bush.

es.text: Por mucho que trabajes, no te subirán el sueldo.

en.text: No matter how hard you work, they won't raise your salary.

es.text: Humedece el sello antes de pegarlo.

en.text: Moisten the stamp before sticking it on.

es.text: Cuando yo vuelva, tendré tiempo de sobra.

en.text: When I come back, I'll have plenty of time.
I think I'm going to throw up.
Don't worry; I don't want to poison you.

es.text: Diles que le digan que venga aquí.

en.text: Tell them to tell him to come here.

es.text: Les dije que le dijeran que viniera aquí.

en.text: I told them to tell him to come here.

es.text: Por lo visto no se lo dijeron.
Estamos metidos en una buen lío.

en.text: Come on, it's not that bad.
On the contrary, I'm a realist.

es.text: Sólo ves el lado malo de las cosas.

en.text: You only see the bad side of things.
I'm sorry but that's the way I am.
Everything will turn out fine, you'll see.
I you had come, we would've won.

es.text: El ganar no es lo más importante.

en.text: Winning's not the most important thing.

es.text: No hay ninguna forma de que puedan ganar.

en.text: There's no way they can win.

es.text: Nuestros jugadores son mejores que los de ellos.

en.text: Our players are better than theirs.

es.text: Todo el mundo trata de complacerte.
Agradezco todo lo que habéis hecho.
No sé lo que habría hecho si no hubiera sido por vuestra ayuda.

en.text: I don't know what I would've done if it hadn't been for your help.

es.text: Los espantapájaros no espantan a los pájaros.

en.text: Scarecrows don't scare away the birds.

es.text: Porque se basa en una nueva tecnología.

en.text: Because it's based on a new technology.
What kind of technology is that?

es.text: Ato a mi hijo mayor al poste.

en.text: I tie my older son to the post.

es.text: ¿Y los pájaros le toman en serio?

en.text: And the birds take him seriously?
He shoots at them with a shotgun.

es.text: Nadar está prohibido durante marea alta.
La luna influye en las mareas.
El consejo de administración aprobó el nuevo presupuesto.

en.text: The board of directors approved the new budget.

es.text: Las previsiones de ventas son buenas.

en.text: We're going to make a killing.
It's a good thing you ducked.
Was I supposed to have ducked?
I can't go on without her.

es.text: Él no puede guardar un secreto.
Tiene rabietas cuando no consigue lo que quiere.

en.text: He has tantrums when he doesn't get what he wants.
Some people are afraid of him.

es.text: Le gusta intimidar a la gente.
Siempre se sale con la suya.

en.text: He's a pain in the neck.

es.text: Algún día le echarán de aquí.

en.text: Someday they'll kick him out of here.

es.text: Le cogieron con las manos en la masa.
Reconozco que no hice un esfuerzo.

en.text: I admit I didn't make an effort.
They punished him with a whip.

es.text: No juzgues el libro por la cubierta.

en.text: Don't judge the book by the cover.
It's better to be safe than sorry.

es.text: ¿Sabes medir la altura de un edificio?

en.text: Do you know how to measure the height of a building?
Do you know how to measure it with a barometer?
Of course I know how to do it.

es.text: Primero voy a la casa del arquitecto.

en.text: First I go to the architect's house.
Then I tell him the following:

es.text: Si me dice Ud. la altura de su edificio, le daré este bonito barómetro.

en.text: If you tell me the height of your building, I'll give you this pretty barometer.
Does a better way occur to you?

es.text: Entonces no me hagas preguntas tontas.

en.text: Then don't ask me silly questions.
Where am I going to find cotton?

es.text: Lo encontrarás en el estante superior.

en.text: You'll find it on the top shelf.

es.text: Lo haré si me la sujetas.

en.text: I'll do it if you hold it for me.

es.text: Tienes miedo de tu propia sombra.

en.text: You're afraid of your own shadow.

es.text: Hay una grieta en el hormigón.

en.text: There's a crack in the concrete.

es.text: El hormigón es una mezcla de arena y cemento.

en.text: Concrete is a mixture of sand and cement.
I think I'm falling in love.

es.text: En serio, nunca me he sentido así.

en.text: Seriously, I've never felt this way.

es.text: No eres capaz de amar a nadie.

en.text: You're not capable of loving anyone.
Thanks a lot! You're a big help.

es.text: Eso es lo último que esperaba oír de ti.

en.text: That's the last thing I expected to hear from you.
How are things going with Mary?

es.text: Ella cree que no soy lo suficientemente inteligente.

en.text: She thinks I'm not intelligent enough.

es.text: Así que estás de acuerdo con ella.
Bueno, digamos que no eres un genio.

en.text: Well, let's say you're not a genius.
But at least I admit it.
I know what my limitations are.
What do you think about this situation?
What do you want me to say?

es.text: Creo que no vale la pena.

en.text: I think it's not worth it.

es.text: O sea, no lo deberíamos hacer.

en.text: In other words, we shouldn't do it.
I think it would be too risky.

es.text: Sí, pero en este caso, el riesgo es alto.

en.text: Yes, but in this case, the risk is high.

es.text: ¿Cuánto vais a invertir en el proyecto?

en.text: How much are you going to invest in the project?
It's impossible for us to fail.

es.text: ¿Cuál es vuestro secreto para el éxito?
Hace falta mucho más que eso.

en.text: It takes a lot more than that.

es.text: Y hace falta un poco de suerte.

en.text: And it takes a little bit of luck.
We don't need any of that.
Then how are you going to succeed?

es.text: Tenemos un producto que se vende a sí mismo.

en.text: We have a product that sells itself.

es.text: Es una poción para los calvos.

en.text: It's a potion for bald people.

es.text: Hace que el pelo crezca un centímetro por semana.

en.text: It makes hair grow a centimetre a week.

es.text: Ya tenemos un pedido de China.

en.text: We already have an order from China.

es.text: Tenemos que embarcar un millón de frascos para dentro de un mes.

en.text: We have to ship a million bottles within a month.
Do you have them in stock?

es.text: No los hemos empezado a fabricar aún.

en.text: We haven't started producing them yet.
You're crazy? How are you going to produce them?

es.text: ¿Qué tengo yo que ver con esto?

en.text: What do I have to do with this?

es.text: Pensé que a lo mejor querrías ayudarnos.

en.text: I thought you might want to help us.
Since when am I a bank?
But you have a lot of money.

es.text: Pero no para tus locas ideas.

en.text: But not for your crazy ideas.
Do you know how many Chinese people are bald?

es.text: 340 millones de chinos querrán nuestro producto.

en.text: 340 million Chinese people will want our product.

es.text: Multiplica eso por 3 dólares por frasco.

en.text: Multiply that by 3 dollars a bottle.
How much money do you think you'll need?

es.text: Bueno, veré lo que pueda hacer.

en.text: Well, I'll see what I can do.

es.text: Puedes conseguir el dinero en una hora.

en.text: You can get the money in an hour.

es.text: ¡Oye, el dinero no crece en los árboles!

en.text: Hey, money doesn't grow on trees!

es.text: Tengo que consultar con mi asesor fiscal.

en.text: I have to consult my tax advisor.

es.text: ¿Qué tiene él que ver con esto?

en.text: What does he have to do with this?

es.text: No puedo darte 80 mil pavos así por las buenas.

en.text: I can't give you 80 thousand bucks just like that.
How does it feel to be a millionaire?
I feel the same as always.

es.text: Creí que tendría más tiempo libre.

en.text: I thought I'd have more free time.

es.text: Pero es mejor que ser pobre.

en.text: But it's better than being poor.

es.text: Tal vez, pero no estoy tan seguro.

en.text: Maybe so, but I'm not so sure.

es.text: Ahora que eres rico y famoso, ¿qué vas a hacer con tu vida?

en.text: Now that you're rich and famous, what are you going to do with your life?

es.text: Voy a realizar todos mis sueños.

en.text: I'm going to fulfil all my dreams.

es.text: No pierdas tu sentido de la dirección.

en.text: Don't lose your sense of direction.
She wears a lot of makeup.

es.text: ¿Cómo puedo compensar por lo que hice?

en.text: How can I make up for what I did?

es.text: Esta es una clase de recuperación.
El comité está compuesto por 3 personas.

en.text: The committee is made up of 3 people.

es.text: Tengo que recuperar el tiempo perdido.

en.text: I have to make up for the lost time.
How can I make it up to you?
Let's make up a list of subjects.

es.text: Creí que tenía el inglés dominado.

en.text: I thought I had English mastered.

es.text: Todavía tienes mucho camino por recorrer.

en.text: You still have a long way to go.

es.text: Sobre todo con verbos y preposiciones.
No sabía que "make up" tenía tantos usos.

en.text: I didn't know "make up" had so many uses.

es.text: Verás que hay centenares de ejemplos con ése.

en.text: You'll see that there are hundreds of examples like that one.

es.text: Te dije que iba a ser difícil.

en.text: I told you it was going to be difficult.

es.text: Me dijiste que querías un reto.

en.text: You told me you wanted a challenge.

es.text: Sabías que no sería un lecho de rosas.

en.text: You knew it wouldn't be a bed of roses.

es.text: Aprender un idioma requiere sangre, sudor y lágrimas.

en.text: Learning a language requires blood, sweat and tears.

es.text: Tienes que estar encima de todo.

en.text: You have to be on top of everything.
You have to show mental agility.

es.text: No sé si estoy por la labor.

en.text: I don't know if I'm up to the task.
Come on, cheer up! Don't get discouraged.
But there's so much to learn!

es.text: No lograrás nada si abandonas ahora.

en.text: You won't accomplish anything if you give up now.

es.text: ¿De verdad crees que soy capaz de aprender todas estas cosas?

en.text: Do you really think I'm capable of learning all these things?

es.text: Ahora es la hora de la verdad.

en.text: Now is the moment of truth.

es.text: No quiero volver a verte desmoralizado.

en.text: I don't want to see you demoralised again.
I'll save a copy for you.

es.text: Tuve un reventón camino de la oficina.

en.text: I had a blow out on the way to work.
They tried to blow up the bridge.
I'm tired of blowing up balloons.

es.text: Ganábamos por 10 puntos y en el último minuto lo fastidiamos.

en.text: We were winning be 10 points and in the last minute we blew it.
The wind blew down the wall.

es.text: No te preocupes, ella sólo está desfogándose.

en.text: Don't worry; she's only blowing off steam.
Let me rest for a minute.

es.text: Esos verbos me están volviendo loca.

en.text: Those verbs are driving my crazy.
Come on, it's not that bad!
You seem to enjoy torturing me.

es.text: ¿Por qué no te quitas esos horribles pendientes?

en.text: Why don't you take off those horrible earrings?

es.text: ¿Quieres que te traiga algo de beber?

en.text: Do you want me to bring you something to drink?

es.text: Estoy bien, pero me pica la espalda.

en.text: I'm okay, but my back itches.
I'll scratch it for you if you want.

es.text: ¡Oye, he dicho un poco más abajo!

en.text: Hey! I said a little lower.

es.text: Pero ¿no te gusta que te rasque la espalda?

en.text: But don't you like me to scratch your back?
Okay, go on, but control yourself.

es.text: Bueno, es hora de volver a la lección.

en.text: Well, it's time to get back to the lesson.
I don't feel like studying now.
What do you feel like doing?

es.text: Quiero que sigas rascándome la espalda.

en.text: I want you to go on scratching my back.
Shall we get back to the lesson?
Shut up silly and keep scratching.

es.text: Tienes la camiseta puesta al revés.

en.text: You have your T-shirt on backwards.

es.text: Se supone que lo llevas de esta forma.

en.text: You're supposed to wear it this way.

es.text: Menos mal que te diste cuenta.

en.text: It's a good thing you realised.
Have you set the alarm clock?
What time will it go off?

es.text: Se me pegaron las sábanas esta mañana.
No puedes permitirte el lujo de quedarte dormido.

en.text: I can't stand getting up early.
I have a terrible time getting up.

es.text: Tardo una hora en despejarme la cabeza.

en.text: It takes me an hour to clear my head.

es.text: Dejo el despertador en el baño.

en.text: I leave the alarm clock in the bathroom.

es.text: Ese me obliga a levantarme para apagarlo.

en.text: That forces me to get up to turn it off.
I can't stand it when it goes off.

es.text: Es un sonido que me vuelve loco.

en.text: It's a sound that drives my crazy.
Are you still looking for a job?
How do you plan to support your family?

es.text: Viviré del sueldo de mi mujer.

en.text: I'll live off my wife's salary.
What does she think about that?
Let's not talk about my wife.

es.text: Estoy harto de la vida de casado.
Ella cree que me puede dar órdenes.

en.text: She thinks she can order me around.
Who does she think she is?

es.text: Le voy a dar un escarmiento.

en.text: I'm going to teach her a lesson.

es.text: Pero es ella quien te mantiene.

en.text: But she's the one who supports you.

es.text: Llevo a los niños al colegio.

en.text: I take the children to school.

es.text: Ayudo a los niños con sus deberes.

en.text: I help the kids with their homework.
I work harder now than before.

es.text: Antes trabajaba ocho horas al día.

en.text: I used to work eight hours a day.

es.text: En cuanto terminas una cosa tienes que empezar con otra.

en.text: As soon as you finish one thing you have to start on something else.

es.text: Al final del día estoy completamente agotado.

en.text: At the end of the day I'm completely exhausted.

es.text: No tengo ganas de hacer nada.

en.text: I don't feel like doing anything.

es.text: Los niños dejan todo en el suelo.

en.text: The kids leave everything on the floor.

es.text: Tengo que recoger detrás de ellos.

en.text: I have to pick up after them.

es.text: La mitad de las veces mi mujer llega a casa de mal humor.

en.text: Half the time my wife gets home in a bad mood.

es.text: Tiene la cara de pedirme que haga la cena.

en.text: She has the nerve to ask me to make dinner.

es.text: Menos mal que soy pésimo cocinero.

en.text: It's a good thing I'm a lousy cook.

es.text: Si no, tendría que hacer la cena todas las noches.

en.text: Otherwise I'd have to make dinner every night.

es.text: La vida de un ama de casa es pesada.

en.text: A housewife's job is a pain in the neck.
Let's go out for a walk.

es.text: Me apetece tomar un poco de aire fresco.

en.text: I feel like getting a little fresh air.
Would you like to come with me?
Those shoes are a little worn out.

es.text: Pero los otros me hacen daño a los pies.

en.text: But the other ones hurt my feet.
Then put on your tennis shoes.

es.text: Te compré unos nuevos. ¿No te acuerdas?

en.text: I bought you some new ones. Don't you remember?

es.text: Están en el cajón superior de tu mesa de noche.

en.text: They're in the top drawer of your bedside table, (night table)

es.text: Están encima de la caja donde están los pasaportes.

en.text: They're on top of the box where the passports are.
They're right in front of you.

es.text: Pero estos cordones son para zapatos de vestir.

en.text: But these laces are for dress shoes.

es.text: Mira debajo del álbum de fotos.

en.text: They're for tennis shoes, aren't they?

es.text: Pero estos cordones son para niños.

en.text: But these shoes laces are for children.
What do you mean for children?
They have tiny stars and stripes.

es.text: ¿Estás loca? Van a pensar que soy pro americano.

en.text: Are you crazy? They're going to think I'm pro-American.

es.text: Entonces iré de paseo yo sola.

en.text: Then I'll go for a walk by myself.
You never want to go out with me.

es.text: Siempre estás buscando excusas para no hacer nada.

en.text: You're always looking for excuses not to do anything.
We used to do everything together.
Now you don't even talk to me.
You always seem tired and irritable.
You don't seem to like anything anymore.

es.text: No sé lo que me pasa.

en.text: I don't know what's the matter with me.
I don't want to argue with you.
By the way, did you speak to your boss?

es.text: ¿No le ibas a pedir un aumento?

en.text: Weren't you going to ask him for a raise?

es.text: No quiero hablar de eso ahora.

en.text: I don't want to talk about that now.

es.text: Entonces ¿cuándo vamos a hablar de ello?

en.text: Then when are we going to talk about it?
Look, leave me alone, will you?

es.text: Puede que vuelva un poco tarde.

en.text: I may be back a little late.

es.text: Tengo que pasar por la casa de David.

en.text: I have to drop by David's house.

es.text: Si tienes hambre, recalienta la pizza de anoche.

en.text: If you're hungry, heat up the pizza from last night.
I'll give your regards to David.

es.text: Ha llegado la hora de tomar una decisión.

en.text: The time has come to make a decision.
I wish we had more information.

es.text: Al menos nos sentiríamos más tranquilos.

en.text: At least we'd feel more reassured.

es.text: La vida está llena de riesgos.
Es más arriesgado no tomar una decisión.

en.text: It's riskier not to make a decision.

es.text: Confía en mí... sé lo que digo.

en.text: Trust me... I know what I'm saying.

es.text: No puedo evitar pensar en los niños.

en.text: I can't help thinking about the kids.

es.text: Nunca pensé que llegaríamos a esto.

en.text: I never thought we'd come to this.

es.text: Deberíamos haber seguido el consejo de mi padre.

en.text: We should've followed my father's advice.
